title: Abolition of Man
author: C.S. Lewis
description: C.S. Lewis shows that education based upon a subjectivistic world view is non-sensible. At the end of the book, he outlines a series of objective moral values that are widely shared by a series of cultures since humanity has recognized them nearly universally.

title: Undesigned Coincidences in the New Testament, Acts and Josephus
author: James John Blunt
description: J.J. Blunt examines small coincidences within the Gospels, Acts and Josephus that can show the the New Testament records eyewitness accounts.

title: The Thomas Factor
author: Gary Habermas
description: Gary discusses doubt in the life of a Christian and offers a thorough analysis of what it is, what causes it, and some solutions.

title: Observations on the Conversion of Saint Paul
author: George Lord Lyttelton
description: This book is from a letter written by George Lyttelton in which he discusses why the conversion of Paul is a powerful argument in favor of Christianity.

title: Is Theology Poetry?
author: C.S. Lewis
description: This essay was originally presented in 1944 at an oxford debating society called the “Socratic Club”. Lewis discusses how the Christian faith answers many of life's questions.

title: Horae Paulinae
author: William Paley
description: Paley’s book contains a thorough analysis of Paul’s letters in order to show that they represent the truth. This book was first published in 1790 but is an easy read.
